Detailed Description

Extented quaternion types and functions.

<glm/gtx/quaternion.hpp> need to be included to use these functionalities.

Function Documentation

template<typename T, precision P>

detail::tvec3< T, P > const &  dest 
) [inline]

Compute the rotation between two vectors. param orig vector, needs to be normalized param dest vector, needs to be normalized

See also:

Definition at line 226 of file quaternion.inl.

References glm::angleAxis(), glm::cross(), glm::dot(), glm::length2(), glm::normalize(), and glm::sqrt().

00230         {
00231                 T cosTheta = dot(orig, dest);
00232                 detail::tvec3<T, P> rotationAxis;
00233 
00234                 if(cosTheta < static_cast<T>(-1) + epsilon<T>())
00235                 {
00236                         // special case when vectors in opposite directions :
00237                         // there is no "ideal" rotation axis
00238                         // So guess one; any will do as long as it's perpendicular to start
00239                         // This implementation favors a rotation around the Up axis (Y),
00240                         // since it's often what you want to do.
00241                         rotationAxis = cross(detail::tvec3<T, P>(0, 0, 1), orig);
00242                         if(length2(rotationAxis) < epsilon<T>()) // bad luck, they were parallel, try again!
00243                                 rotationAxis = cross(detail::tvec3<T, P>(1, 0, 0), orig);
00244 
00245                         rotationAxis = normalize(rotationAxis);
00246                         return angleAxis(pi<T>(), rotationAxis);
00247                 }
00248 
00249                 // Implementation from Stan Melax's Game Programming Gems 1 article
00250                 rotationAxis = cross(orig, dest);
00251 
00252                 T s = sqrt((T(1) + cosTheta) * static_cast<T>(2));
00253                 T invs = static_cast<T>(1) / s;
00254 
00255                 return detail::tquat<T, P>(
00256                         s * static_cast<T>(0.5f), 
00257                         rotationAxis.x * invs,
00258                         rotationAxis.y * invs,
00259                         rotationAxis.z * invs);
00260         }

00180                 if(a >= static_cast<T>(1)) return y;

00183                 detail::tquat<T, P> y2(y); //BUG!!! tquat<T> y2;
00184                 if(fCos < static_cast<T>(0))
00185                 {
00186                         y2 = -y;
00187                         fCos = -fCos;
00188                 }

00190                 //if(fCos > 1.0f) // problem
00191                 T k0, k1;
00192                 if(fCos > (static_cast<T>(1) - epsilon<T>()))
00193                 {
00194                         k0 = static_cast<T>(1) - a;
00195                         k1 = static_cast<T>(0) + a; //BUG!!! 1.0f + a;
00196                 }
00197                 else
00198                 {
00199                         T fSin = sqrt(T(1) - fCos * fCos);
00200                         T fAngle = atan(fSin, fCos);
00201                         T fOneOverSin = static_cast<T>(1) / fSin;
00202                         k0 = sin((static_cast<T>(1) - a) * fAngle) * fOneOverSin;
00203                         k1 = sin((static_cast<T>(0) + a) * fAngle) * fOneOverSin;
00204                 }
